\msgrows[3]The ginger should be at the end of the aisle.
\msgrows[3]Oh I'm sorry! My hat is broken and I need some
string to fix it. But only the finest silk in
all of Okaqke will be able to fix my hat!
\msgrows[3]Hmmm... Maybe there is someone around here
who knows where to get such silk.
\msgrows[1]Teo needs to be looking this way.
\msgrows[3]I have a golden card. May I have those scissors now?
\msgrows[3]Your card smells suspiciously.\.\. sweet. But Im not paid
enough to question it. Here you go. Cut away. Just stay away
from my scarves with those things!
\msgrows[3]They are extremely sharp, mind you. Maybe if you
have a gold membership card, I would let you borrow them.
\msgrows[3]Hmmm.\.\. I only have a silver card. Would that work?
\msgrows[3]Ha! Not unless its been dipped in some liquid gold.

\msgrows[3]Hi. Um... Im looking for some high quality silk
to help a friend. Would I be able to get some of yours?
\msgrows[3]Aye, my silk is of high quality. Its worth a fortune
here in Okaqke. My string is strong enough to restrain even a raging
minotaur, but not so much against pure gold shears.
\msgrows[3]Aside from golden scissors, my own children can cut through
my string too. My little Mo recently cut themself loose. So if you
bring Mo back, I may give you some silk string.
\msgrows[1]Hmm... We could help find the missing spider,
or we could cut some silk for ourselves.
\msgrows[3]Do you have any idea where your son might be?
\msgrows[3]My boy Mo loves to play hide and seek.
